reviewText: This movie is plotless and pointless and terrible. Save your money.
If you miss the Austin of the early 90's this is a must see

I agree with many of the reviewers that the Criterion edition has an incredible treasure trove of extras. This review however is of the film, which is a rambling, inconsistent movie that doesn't have any plot whatsoever. Also, much of the dialogue rambles on and on about incoherent subjects. However, I deeply respect this filmmaker, and I deeply respect what he was going for, which was a portrait of a people in a particular time period in a specific setting. I also enjoyed Linklater's approach of following characters and then veering off to follow someone else.
Fun film. One of the first films directed by Richard Linklater. Had the opportunity of seeing this in College when I took a Contemporary Cinema course. A good addition for any avid film collector.
Excellent feeling of the era portrayed.
A very good early Richard Linklater film. This Criterion Collection edition offers many extras.
